    Node

    public class Noise
extends AbstractTerrainGenerator
    Class that implements noise based terrain generating algorithms.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Constructor Detail

      • Noise

        public Noise(int lod,
             float roughness,
             float size,
             AbstractNoiseGenerator noiseGenerator)
        Constructor, sets the application Window, and initializes the terrain height map. Used by noise generators.
        Parameters:
        lod - the level of detail of the heightmap to generate. lod corresponds to the integer variable k in the formula (2 ^ k) + 1, where k = 1, 2, 3 ... is the value of both the length and width of the heightmap, stored in the GeometryGen class "terrain" variable. The value of (2 ^ k) + 1 gives the number of points per line of the grid. The higher k is the more detailed is the generated heightmap, i.e., more points are generated. Consequently, more details means more time to calculate the heightmap values, and to render the generated terrain.
        roughness - the value that will increase or decrease the random interval added to each new generated height.
        size - (considering a squared game world) of one of the game world sides.
        noiseGenerator - to use.
